characters.name: Dasha
characters.info: Dasha was a very happy and productive child but then a series of unfortunate events came into her life. Her parents died, her best friend moved away, her foster family was terrible to her and her country was on the brink of war. She felt betrayed, mistreated and abused by people and the system. When she was 18 she had to make a choice: fight for survival, let her past destroy her or to let it all go and have fun. She chose the third option, using fun as a weapon to take back her life.

ability.name: Partying On
ability.desc: Reduce damage taken and recovery time from falls. Reduce rate of recoil buildup and maximum recoil.

weapons.name: RGS50
weapons.desc: The anti-materiel Launcher (AML) can lock on to vehicles. However, it does less damage to non-vehicle units.

maps.name: Survival mode
maps.desc:
In survival mode, players have to gather natural resources such as wood and stone found in the environment in order to craft certain blocks and items.
Depending on the difficulty, monsters spawn in darker areas outside a certain radius of the character, requiring players to build a shelter at night. The mode also has a health bar which is depleted by attacks from mobs, falls, drowning, falling into lava, suffocation, starvation, and other events.
Players also have a hunger bar, which must be periodically refilled by eating food in-game, except in peaceful difficulty.
If the hunger bar is depleted, automatic healing will stop and eventually health will deplete. Health replenishes when players have a nearly full hunger bar or continuously on peaceful difficulty.
 
Players can craft a wide variety of items in Minecraft. Craftable items include armor, which mitigates damage from attacks; weapons (such as swords or axes), which allows monsters and animals to be killed more easily; and tools, which break certain types of blocks more quickly. 
Some items have multiple tiers depending on the material used to craft them, with higher-tier items being more effective and durable.
Players can construct furnaces, which can cook food, process ores, and convert materials into other materials. 
Players may also exchange goods with a villager (NPC) through a trading system, which involves trading emeralds for different goods and vice versa. 
 
The game has an inventory system, allowing players to carry a limited number of items. Upon dying, items in the players' inventories are dropped unless the game is reconfigured not to do so. Players then re-spawn at their spawn point, which by default is where players first spawn in the game, and can be reset by sleeping in a bed or using a respawn anchor.
Dropped items can be recovered if players can reach them before they disappear or despawn after 5 minutes. Players may acquire experience points by killing mobs and other players, mining, smelting ores, breeding animals, and cooking food.
Experience can then be spent on enchanting tools, armor and weapons. Enchanted items are generally more powerful, last longer, or have other special effects

maps.name: Hardcore mode
maps.desc: Hardcore mode is a survival mode variant that is locked to the hardest setting and has permadeath. If a player dies in a hardcore world, they are no longer allowed to interact with it, so they can either be put into spectator mode and explore the world or delete it entirely. This game mode can only be accessed within the Java Edition.

maps.name: Creative mode
maps.desc: In creative mode, players have access to nearly all resources and items in the game through the inventory menu, and can place or remove them instantly. Players can toggle the ability to fly freely around the game world at will, and their characters do not take any damage and are not affected by hunger. The game mode helps players focus on building and creating projects of any size without disturbance

maps.name: Adventure mode
maps.desc: Adventure mode was designed specifically so that players could experience user-crafted custom maps and adventures. Gameplay is similar to survival mode but with various restrictions, which can be applied to the game world by the creator of the map. This forces players to obtain the required items and experience adventures in the way that the map maker intended. Another addition designed for custom maps is the command block; this block allows map makers to expand interactions with players through scripted server commands.

maps.name: Spectator mode
maps.desc: Spectator mode allows players to fly through blocks and watch gameplay without directly interacting. Players do not have an inventory, but can teleport to other players and view from the perspective of another player or creature

guides.title: Breed cows animals over pigs
guides.content: On the off chance that you should pick among cows and pigs, pick cows animals. In spite of the fact that the two of them yield meat, cows animals will likewise yield milk and calfskin making them more valuable to you and your making venture.

guides.title: Be cautious where you Dig
guides.content: Digging underground in Minecraft is consistently unsafe as it can uncover magma or mines. The more awful activity is burrowed straightforwardly down. All things being equal, use stairs to try not to any burrow threats. On the off chance that you out of nowhere end up confronted with magma (lava), you can rapidly stop the stream by utilizing blocks, for example, cobblestone.

guides.title: Follow the sun and moon in the event that you get lost
guides.content: Continuously know about where the sun and moon are. This is particularly helpful when you are in a new area. Regardless of what biome you are in, the sun and moon will ascend in the East and Set in the West. Utilize this stunt to consistently know which bearing you are voyaging.

guides.title: Get yourself some obsidian
guides.content: On the off chance that you need to arrive at the Nether rapidly, obsidian is the most ideal way to ensure you gather it as snappy as could reasonably be expected. You can at present form an entryway even without a pickaxe.

guides.title: Build multiple things at once
guides.content: You are not restricted to making each thing in turn. It is conceivable to construct a few crafts in one go which is an extraordinary efficient device.

guides.title: Try not to attempt to do excessively
guides.content: Try not to attempt to do a lot by running or bouncing, your yearning levels can increment quickly. You will at that point have the extra test of discovering more food to continue working which burns through valuable time and assets.

guides.title: Continuously watch out for your gear
guides.content: Continuously guarantee you have fundamental hardware in your stock, you will become more acquainted with rapidly what basics you need. Having these in your stock will give you true serenity and means you don’t need to get back to restock as frequently. You can likewise have to an extreme with regards to valuable assets.

guides.title: Avoid skeletons
guides.content: In spite of the fact that there are a few crowds you ought to be careful about, the skeletons can cause the most issues, so attempt to evade these anyplace conceivable when you first beginning off in endurance mode. Skeletons are incredibly exact and can slaughter you rapidly so when you see one, run.

guides.title: Get experience score / Points
guides.content: In the event that you need to advance and start charming, you will require insight. You can pick up this experience through hordes, rearing, and mining certain materials, for example, coral, emerald, and under quartz.

vehicles.name: Boat
vehicles.desc:
Overview:
A boat is a vehicle and an item used for transporting a player across bodies of water or surfaces of ice.


Mechanics:
To mount a boat, a player must use the item. It can be exited by pressing the Sneak key, and, in Bedrock Edition, by pressing down the right analog stick, tapping on the Leave Boat button, or pressing the Jump key.

With a keyboard or gamepad, boats are controlled using the keyboard on computers, the left stick on consoles, or touchscreen buttons on mobile devices.

vehicles.name: Minecart with Furnace
vehicles.desc:
Overview:
The minecart with furnace (aka powered minecart) is a variation of the regular minecart, which can be used to push other minecarts along a rail system, if it's powered.


Mechanics:
The minecart with furnace accepts coal or charcoal for smelting. Fuel can be added by right-clicking on it while holding coal/charcoal. Doing this will cause it to travel along a rail, in the direction a player was facing when they added the fuel. As it moves along the rail, it will push any other minecarts along in front of it. Right-clicking it again will change its direction. It can travel along a rail for 3 minutes for each piece of coal/charcoal inside.
When destroyed, it will give back a minecart and a furnace separately. However, any fuel that was still left inside, will be lost. It cannot be used to cook food or smelt ore, and players cannot ride in it.

vehicles.name: Minecart with Chest
vehicles.desc:
Overview:
Minecarts with Chests (also known as Storage Minecarts or Chest Minecarts) are Minecarts that cannot be ridden, but instead, they can store up to 27 stacks of items and blocks, just like a regular Chest. Items can be placed in or taken out of a storage minecart through the use of a Hopper, but not surprisingly, by a Minecart with Hopper. Minecarts with chests can be accessed at any time when a player is in range, and there is not a solid block between them and the minecart, even if there is a block above the minecart. A minecart with chest won't show the opening animation/sound as regular chests do.


Usage:
Minecarts with chests can be used to store items without anybody seeing -
the item - or simply used, for example, to add Books to a

This is done with: any block of a player's choice, a minecart with chest, a Button, a Piston, and a Rail. For the block of a player's choice, use a Bookshelf. First, delete a vertical row of 2 blocks (do NOT destroy the block that touches the ground). Put a rail on the block and then place the minecart.
Destroy the block that was placed on the rail and minecart on top of it. The minecart will fall down and the rail will be destroyed (remember: the minecart will turn around when the block is destroyed, so it's recommended that the rail is facing towards the direction that a player was looking). Next, place down a piston looking down and insert a button on the block nearest to the piston. Then, place the bookshelf under the piston and press the button. The bookshelf will go through the minecart. Now, destroy the piston and place down bookshelves to fill the empty spaces.
Note that, if the minecart switches direction away from the direction a player was looking at, then a part of the minecart will show up when the button pushed, and that will show everyone else where the minecart is, so it's highly suggested to make sure the minecart isn't looking vertically

vehicles.name: Minecart with TNT
vehicles.desc:
Overview:
A Minecart with TNT is used to blow up blocks in moderation. When it explodes, it will not destroy any rails beneath it as well as any blocks that the rails are on. They will blow up if they go over an active activator rail, with an explosion delay of 4 seconds; however, they can also be detonated by shooting flaming arrows or other fire sources at them, getting attacked while moving, it falls 3 blocks, or it takes a sharp turn next to a block. Minecarts with TNT are often banned from servers since it is a good way for griefers to destroy mines or roads with rails.

vehicles.name: Minecart with Hopper
vehicles.desc:
Overview:
The Minecart with Hopper (or Hopper Minecart) is a Minecart that has a hopper inside of it. It can pick up items and take items out of the storage above itself.


Usage:
A minecart with hopper will travel along rails like any minecart; however, any nearby items will be pulled into its inventory. It will also pull items from storage above itself; however, it does this 7.4 times faster than a regular hopper, which will push items into the hopper minecart if its orientation is correct. While a minecart with hopper will not push items into containers unless it goes into a chest, hoppers will pull items from any hopper minecart that it can.
If a minecart with hopper goes over a powered Activator Rail, it will lose its abilities, and if it goes over an unpowered activator rail, it will regain its abilities. The exception is that hoppers can still push and pull items to and from a minecart with hopper. When it is on a Detector Rail, a Redstone Comparator can detect the cart's capacity the same way it detects the fullness of a regular hopper or any other block that contains items.

vehicles.name: Minecart with Command Block
vehicles.desc:
Overview:
The Minecart with Command Block (also known as Command Block Minecart) is a type of Minecart found in Minecraft. This type of minecart is a command block and a minecart combined
Much like regular Command Blocks, the minecart with command block is only obtainable by using either /give @p command_block_minecart or external tools. It can also be obtained via /summon, like the other different types of minecarts. However, unlike the other minecart types, command block minecarts cannot be crafted in vanilla Minecraft.


Uses:
This can be used as a command block on the go. The minecart with command block is used to run commands and travel. It can be more useful than a command block in some situations, and less useful in others. For example, a benefit of command block minecarts is that one does not need to give it input from a Clock circuit; for as long as it is powered, it will repeatedly run the command, once every four game ticks (five times per second). Relative coordinates can be very useful in minecart command block commands. For example, giving the XYZ as 6, 2, 0 (without the quote marks) means the block that is 6 South and 2 up from the minecart's current location. Since the minecart's location is constantly changing, a setblock command using relative coordinates can draw a wall (poorly and with gaps). The ID of the command block itself is command_block_minecart.

info.name: Chest
info.info: A chest is used to store items or blocks. It looks similar to your inventory. Chests can hold up to 27 stacks of either blocks or items. If two chests are placed side by side, it becomes a double chest. Double chests can hold the double amont of one chest, which is 54 stacks.

info.name: Crafting Table
info.info: The crafting table, sometimes called workbench, is one of the key ingredients in Minecraft. It provides you with the 3x3 crafting grid, which you need for almost any recipe. When placed on the ground, you just right-click the crafting table to bring up the crafting grid.

info.name: Furnace
info.info: TFurnaces or sometimes called ovens, can be used to smelt things and cook food. For example it can smelt iron ores into iron. To use, place the furnace somewhere and right-click it. You will need fuel to heat up the furnace. Wood, coal and other things like that, can be used as fuel.

info.name: Stick
info.info: Sticks are used in various crafting recipes, for example weapons, tools, torches and signs. Two wood planks gives you four sticks.

info.name: Torches
info.info: Torches creates a permanent light when placed on walls or other suitable surfaces. Light keeps evil mobs from spawning.

info.name: Wood Planks
info.info: Wood planks are crafted from wood. Wood planks are very common, because of the high occurrence of wood in any biome. Wood planks are used in many crafting recipes. As with wood, wood planks catch fire very easily.

info.name: Axes
info.info: Used to chop wood and pumpkins, faster than by hand.
info.ingredients: Sticks + Wood Planks or Cobblestone or Iron Ingots or Gold Ingots or Diamonds

info.name: Bucket
info.info: Used to carry water, lava or milk. Water and lava can be gathered from water or lava blocks, that are not running. Milk can be obtained by clicking on a cow with the bucket.

info.name: Carrot on a Stick
info.info: Used while riding pigs to control them. The direction the carrot dangles is the direction the pig will go. The pig will run faster if the player right clicks while holding the stick.

info.name: Clock
info.info: Clocks are items that display the current in-game time. It is done by displaying the sun and the moon's position, relative to the horizon.

info.name: Compass
info.info: The compass will always point to your original spawn point. Can't be used in The Nether or in The End.

info.name: Fishing Rod
info.info: Used to catch fish. You can also use them to grab movable objects and drag them towards yourself. Rods have 33 uses (durability).

info.name: Flint and Steel
info.info: Used to create fire. Can set blocks or creatures on fire.

info.name: Hoes
info.info: Used to till dirt and grass into farmland for crops. There is a chance that seeds will drop, when you till grass blocks.
info.ingredients: Sticks + Wood Planks or Cobblestone or Iron Ingots or Gold Ingots or Diamonds

info.name: Map
info.info: The Map is used to view explored terrain. While a map is being held in the player's hand, it will gradually be drawn as the player explores the world.

info.name: Pickaxes
info.info: Used to mine ore and blocks. Only Iron and Diamond Pickaxes can mine all ores and blocks. Diamond is the strongest pickaxe.
info.ingredients: Sticks + Wood Planks or Cobblestone or Iron Ingots or Gold Ingots or Diamonds

info.name: Shears
info.info: Tools used to obtain wool from sheeps, leaves from trees, Red Mushrooms from Mushrooms or to get string from cobwebs.

info.name: Shovels
info.info: Used to effectively dig sand, dirt, gravel, snow and clay. Required to dig snowballs.
info.ingredients: Sticks + Wood Planks or Cobblestone or Iron Ingots or Gold Ingots or Diamonds

info.name: Arrow
info.info: Arrows can be used as ammunition for a bow or dispenser. Deals damage to players and creatures when they hit.

info.name: Bow
info.info: Ranged weapon used to fire arrows. To use the bow you must have arrows in your inventory.

info.name: Damaged Shield
info.info: The durability of two shields is added together, plus an extra 5% durability. The repaired shield has no pattern.

info.name: Patterned Shield
info.info: Applies the banner pattern to the shield. The banner is consumed. The shield must have no preexisting patterns. Repairs the shield to full durability at the same time.

info.name: Shield
info.info: Shields are used to block incoming attacks. When a shield blocks an attack, it will take damage. Blockable attacks include mob melee attacks, thrown items such as snowballs, arrows, damage from Thorns, some explosions and fireballs.

info.name: Spectral Arrow
info.info: Spectral arrows imbues the glowing effect for 10 seconds. The glowing effect creates an outline of the target, which is visible through blocks and colored based on the targets team (default is white). If a bow is enchanted with Infinity, spectral arrows will still be consumed.

info.name: Swords
info.info: Melee weapon used to damage mobs, other player or to block attacks.
info.ingredients: Stick + Wood Planks or Cobblestone or Iron Ingots or Gold Ingots or Diamonds

info.name: Tipped Arrow
info.info: Tipped arrows imbue a status effect when hitting a mob or player. The duration of the effect is 1/8 that of the corresponding potion, and is not affected by the power of the arrow. The effect is the same as the regular power effect for the potion. If a bow is enchanted with Infinity, tipped arrows will still be consumed.

info.name: Boots
info.info: Foot armor that adds extra protection against attacks, falling, fire and drowning.
info.ingredients: Leather or Gold Ingots or Iron Ingots or Fire or Diamonds

info.name: Chestplates
info.info: Chest armor that adds extra protection against attacks, falling, fire and drowning.
info.ingredients: Leather or Gold Ingots or Iron Ingots or Fire or Diamonds

info.name: Helmets
info.info: Head armor that adds extra protection against attacks, falling, fire and drowning.
info.ingredients: Leather or Gold Ingots or Iron Ingots or Fire or Diamonds

info.name: Leggins
info.info: Leg armor that adds extra protection against attacks, falling, fire and drowning.
info.ingredients: Leather or Gold Ingots or Iron Ingots or Fire or Diamonds

info.name: Andesite
info.info: Andesite is a type of igneous rock. Andesite can be mined using any pickaxe. If mined without a pickaxe, it will drop nothing. Used as decoration.

info.name: Anvil
info.info: Used to combine enchantments and repair and rename items or blocks. Anvils are affected by gravity.

info.name: Beacon
info.info: Emits a light beam that can provide temporary player buffs, when placed on a pyramid made of diamond, emerald, gold or iron blocks. Can also be used as a landmark.

info.name: Block of Coal
info.info: The block of coal is a compact way to store coal, and can be used for decoration and fuel.

info.name: Block of Quartz
info.info: Blocks of Quartz are mineral blocks crafted from Nether Quartz that are used only for decoration.

info.name: Block of Redstone
info.info: Redstone blocks are compacted blocks can be used as a redstone power source.

info.name: Bone Block
info.info: Bone blocks are decorative blocks that can face in different directions, can also be used as compact storage for bonemeal. Bone blocks are generated naturally as part of fossil structures found in desert and swampland biomes. 1 Bone Block will give you 9 Bone Meal.

info.name: Bookshelf
info.info: Used as decoration or to give an Enchantment Table, a boost for better enchantments.

info.name: Brick Block
info.info: Decorative building material.

info.name: Chiseled Quartz Block
info.info: Used as decorative building material.

info.name: Chiseled Sandstone
info.info: Chiseled Sandstone is a decorative form of sandstone with a Creeper face and various small carvings on it.
info.ingredients: Sandstone Slab or Red Sandstone Slab.

info.name: Activator Rail
info.info: Used to activate TNT Minecarts or Minecarts with Hoppers.

info.name: Boat
info.info: Vehicle that enables you to travel in water, faster than swimming.

info.name: Detector Rail
info.info: Functions like a Pressure Plate, it sends a Redstone signal when powered. Can only be activated by a minecart.
info.ingredients: Stone Pressure Plate + Iron Ingots + Redstone

info.name: Minecart
info.info: Rideable objects used for transporting players or mobs along minetracks.

info.name: Minecart with Chest
info.info: Used to transport goods and items along rails.

info.name: Minecart with Hopper
info.info: Minecart that moves items in and out of chests in the same way as a normal hopper.

info.name: Minecart with TNT
info.info: Minecart with TNT that explodes when triggered by a activator rail or when it is hit.

info.name: Powered Minecart
info.info: Minecarts with Furnace can be used to push other minecarts. You need fuel to power this minecart.

info.name: Powered Rail
info.info: Non solid block that is used to stop or increase momentum of moving minecarts. Powered Rails are powered by Redstone currents. Whether this comes from a Redstone Torch, a Lever, a Button, another circuit, or a Detector Rail does not matter.

info.name: Rails
info.info: Rails are minecart tracks where minecart vehicles can travel along.

info.name: Daylight Sensor
info.info: Sends out a redstone signal during sunlight. The signal strenght depends on the sunlight intensity.

info.name: Dispenser
info.info: Dispensers can store 9 stacks of items or blocks in a 3x3 grid. When powered by a Redstone charge, it ejects the items in random order. Snowballs, eggs, fireworks and arrows are fired out as projectiles.

info.name: Doors
info.info: Wooden Doors can be activated by right-clicking on them or by an electrical redstone signal. Iron Doors on the other hand, can only be activated by an electrical redstone signal.

info.name: Dropper
info.info: Block that drops an item from it's inventory as an entity (as if it were dropped by the player)each time it is powered. If there is a block with an inventory immediately in front of the dropper when it is powered, it will instead store the item within th

info.name: Hopper
info.info: Moves items in and out of chests, dispensers and other blocks that can hold items.

info.name: Iron Trapdoor
info.info: A trapdoor is a non-solid block that can be used as an openable barrier. Iron trapdoors are activated by redstone.

info.name: Jukebox
info.info: Used to play music discs. Right-click the jukebox with a music disc selected to play it.

info.name: Lever
info.info: Sends an electrical signal when switched to the on position. Stays in its current state, unless it is clicked again.

info.name: Note Block
info.info: Plays a note when used or powered by redstone. Right click it to change the pitch of the note. A different instrument is played depending on the type of block it is placed on.

info.name: Piston
info.info: Pushes blocks or entities 1 space forward. Can also move players and mobs. Activated by redstone circuits.
info.ingredients: Wood Planks + Cobblestone + Iron Ingot + Redstone

info.name: Pressure Plates
info.info: Triggers an electrical charge, when a player or mob walks on it. Wood Pressure Plates are also activated when something is dropped on them.

info.name: Redstone Comparator
info.info: Function similar to redstone repeaters. However, instead of one signal, the comparator receives two signals.

info.name: Beetroot Soup
info.info: Beetroot soup can be eaten to restore 6 hunger and 7.2 hunger saturation. Beetroot soup is a liquid food item in the Pocket and PC edition.

info.name: Bowl
info.info: Used to hold mushroom stew and to milk a Mooshroom cow.

info.name: Bread
info.info: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 2.5 hunger points.

info.name: Cake
info.info: Restores 1 hunger point per use for a total of 6 uses. Returns empty buckets when crafted. Must be placed to eat.

info.name: Cookie
info.info: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 1 hunger point.

info.name: Enchanted Golden Apple
info.info: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 2 hunger points and regenerate health for 30 seconds. It also gives resistance and fire resistance for 5 minutes.

info.name: Golden Apple
info.info: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 2 hunger points and regenerates health temporarily.

info.name: Golden Carrot
info.info: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 4 hunger points. Golden Carrot is also used in some brewing recipes.

info.name: Melon Seeds
info.info: Plantable on farmland. Will produce one Melon Block each harvest.

info.name: Mushroom Stew
info.info: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 3 hunger points. The bowl can reused.

info.name: Pumpkin Pie
info.info: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 4 hunger points. Recipe fits within the 2x2 crafting grid of the players inventory.

info.name: Pumpkin Seeds
info.info: Plantable on farmland. Will produce one Pumpkin each harvest.

info.name: Armor Stand
info.info: Armor Stands are entities that are able to hold and display wearable items. Can display armor, mob heads or pumpkins.

info.name: Banner
info.info: Banners or Flags are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes. Check out banner guide for more recipes.

info.name: Bed
info.info: Used to change time from night to day. In SMP, all players in the Overworld must be in beds. Also changes the spawn point of the player, but compasses remains unaffected until you die and respawn.

info.name: Book
info.info: Used to create book and quills, bookshelfs or an enchantment table.

info.name: Book and Quill
info.info: Books that players can write in, read and edit.

info.name: Carpet
info.info: Carpets are thin like pressure plates and can be used as floor decoration. The color of the wool determines the carpet color.

info.name: Cobblestone Wall
info.info: Decorative block that acts in a similar way to fences.

info.name: End Crystal
info.info: End crystals are found atop the many obsidian pillars in the End. Their primary purpose is to recharge the health of the ender dragon. When attacked or otherwise damaged in any way, they will explode. The ender crystal explosion is the same power as a charged creeper, 50% more powerful than TNT. As items, end crystals may be placed on bedrock and obsidian. If one is placed on each of the four sides of the end exit portal, the crystals will respawn the healing crystals and the dragon before exploding.
info.ingredients: Glass + Eye of Ender + Ghast Tear

info.name: End Rod
info.info: End rods are decorative light sources that emit white particles. Popped Chorus Fruits can be obtained by smelting chorus fruit. End rods can be obtained by any tool or block. They will also break if run over by flowing water. End rods generate naturally all over end cities. End rods emit a light level of 14 (same as torches).

info.name: Ender Chest
info.info: Used for storage like normal chests. All contents of the chest are put into all Ender Chests created, which means they access the same storage. The contents are localised to the player in SMP. If the ender chest is destroyed, none of its contents will be

info.name: Eye of Ender
info.info: Used to locate Strongholds, repair an End Portal bloc and craft Ender Chests. When thrown, they float towards the direction of a portal, which appear in strongholds. After a few seconds, it will drop with a chance of breaking.

info.name: Fence
info.info: Used as a barrier that players and mobs cannot jump over. The only exception are spiders and spider jockeys. It is 1.5 blocks high for mobs and players, but only 1 block high to other blocks.

info.name: Fence Gate
info.info: Fence gates serves as a door for a row of fences. They can be opened both inward and outwards. They are opened by right-clicking or with a redstone signal.

info.name: Blaze Powder
info.info: Can be combined with an Ender Pearl to make an Eye of Ender. Can also be used to craft Magma Cream, Fire charges and Potions of Strength.

info.name: Brewing Stand
info.info: Brewing stands are used for brewing all kinds potions.

info.name: Cauldron
info.info: Storage of water for water bottles. They can fill glass bottles to make water bottles. Holds enough water for three water bottles.

info.name: Enchantment Table
info.info: The enchantment table allows users to use experience levels to enchant weapons, armor, and tools.

info.name: Fermented Spider Eye
info.info: Used in Potions. All potions with Fermented Spider Eye in have negative effects. This ingredient is mostly used in splash potions.

info.name: Glass Bottle
info.info: Used for brewing potions. To create a water bottle, right click on a water source with an empty bottle.

info.name: Glistering Melon
info.info: Used in brewing to create health restoration potions.

info.name: Gold Nugget
info.info: Used to craft Glistering Melon. Dropped by Zombie Pigman. Can be crafted into Gold Ingots.

info.name: Magma Cream
info.info: Used in Potions, mostly for fire resistance.

info.name: Bone Meal
info.info: Bone Meal or white dye, is used to color wool or sheeps light white.

info.name: Cyan Dye
info.info: Used to color wool or sheeps cyan.

info.name: Dandelion Yellow Dye
info.info: Used to color wool or sheeps yellow.

info.name: Gray Dye
info.info: Used to color wool or sheep's gray.

info.name: Light Blue Dye
info.info: Used to color wool or sheeps light blue.

info.name: Light Gray Dye
info.info: Used to dye wool light gray. Can be made using an ink sac and two bonemeal or gray dye and bonemeal. Combining gray dye with bonemeal is better because you make 4 light gray dye from every ink sac (instead of 3).
info.ingredients: Ink Sack + Bone Meal or Gray Dye + Bone Meal

info.name: Lime Dye
info.info: Used to color wool or sheeps green.

info.name: Magenta Dye
info.info: Used to color wool or sheeps magenta.

info.name: Orange Dye
info.info: Used to color wool or sheeps orange.
info.ingredients: Rose Red Dye + Dandelion Yellow Dye

info.name: Pink Dye
info.info: Used to color wool or sheeps pink.

info.name: Purple Dye
info.info: Used to color wool or sheeps purple.

info.name: Rose Red Dye
info.info: Rose red is a primary color dye created primarily from flowers. Like all other dyes, rose red can be: 1) Applied to sheep to dye their wool, which can then be sheared for 13 blocks of rose red wool. 2) Applied to tamed wolves, to dye their collars. 3) Combined with gunpowder to make a firework star. 4) Combined with a firework star to create a fade to color effect. 5) Used to dye leather armor. 6) Used to dye wool, or stain glass or hardened clay. 7) Used to add patterns to banners.
info.ingredients: Poppy or Red Tulip or Rose Bush or Beetroot
